summary: usain bolt will compete at the iaaf/btc world relays in the bahamas . the six-time olympic gold medallist will compete at the relay championship on may 2 and 3 as part of the jamaican team . 'i'm happy to be part of the jamaican team for the iaaf / btc world relays in the bahamas. i am fit, healthy and ready to run,' said bolt .

explain:
To make clear, describe or summarize the key concept or principal point.

Summary: Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas as part of the Jamaican team. He mentions that he is fit, healthy, and ready to run. The core idea of the given aspect is to highlight Usain Bolt's participation in the event as a member of the Jamaican team. The aspect focuses on his role and nationality rather than any specific performance or accomplishments during the relay championship.

To provide an explanation or clarification of a concept, term, or process.

In the given aspect, the core idea is that Usain Bolt is physically fit, healthy, and mentally prepared to participately in the iaaf/btc World Relays in the Bahamas as part of the Jamaican team. This idea is supported by the statement that Bolt says, "I'm happy to be part of the Jamaican team for the iaaf/btc World Relays in the Bahamas. I am fit, healthy, and ready to run." This indicates that Bolt has undergone necessary training, maintained his physical health, and is psychologically prepared to compete with other athletes in the championship.

Bolt's participation in the IAAF/BTC World Relays is significant because it highlights Jamaica's strong tradition in relay races. As a six-time Olympic gold medalist, Bolt aims to uphold and showcase Jamaica's strong relay history. His participation not only adds to the excitement of the event but also motivates his team to perform at their best. The country has a long legacy of excellence in relay races, and Bolt's presence only further solidifies Jamaica's reputation as a powerhouse in the field. In addition to promoting his own legacy, Bolt is also committed to making Jamaica proud and contributing to the nation's success in the relay championships.

Garth Gayle, the JAAA General Secretary, expresses his approval towards Usain Bolt's selection to compete at the 2021 IAAF/BTC World Relays as part of the Jamaican team. It suggests that the JAAA acknowledges Bolt's abilities and believes that his participation would bring valuable recognition and possibly success to the team. This suggests that the JAAA is encouraging Bolt to participate, despite his age and the recent changes in the athletic landscape, as they consider him a valuable asset to the team.

In summary, Garth Gayle's delight in Bolt's selection indicates that the JAAA believes the six-time Olympic gold medalist would be an asset to the team and provide valuable exposure for the championship, despite his advancing age and the recent changes in the athletic landscape.

This aspect refers to the complete list of athletes who will represent Jamaica in the competition, including Usain Bolt.
